newsitem.title: USA: Novell says intranet platform boosts Q4.
newsitem.headline: Novell says intranet platform boosts Q4.

text.p: Novell Inc said on Tuesday that first shipments of its IntranetWare platform drove sales of its directory enabled servers up 38 percent in the fourth quarter, to $181 million, from the third quarter.
Total server software sales for the fourth quarter were $247 million, the company said.
IntranetWare provides a full-service intranet platform, allowing customers to access information on intranets and the Internet with a Web server, browser and Internet connectivity, the company said.

Earlier in the day, the company reported earnings of $0.17 per share for the fourth quarter ended October 31, compared with $0.16 per share in the year ago period. Revenues were down to $383.7 million from $480.5 million in the 1995 fourth quarter.
The company attributed the decline in revenues to the sale or discontinuation of product lines in the past year.
